availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Greenup (Franklin County, Kentucky, merchant and grocer)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, merchant and grocer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Dehoney Greenup in Woodford County, Kentucky, on December 9, 1847. Merchant in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Grocer in Franklin County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin, District 1, p. 31A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin, District 1, p. 867B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin, Frankfort, p. 87.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin, Frankfort, p. 490B.
Kentucky Marriage Records (1783-1965), Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, KY, Woodford County Marriages, Film 000252332.
